verses.text: When the great Lord will, he shall be filled with the spirit of understanding: he shall pour out wise sentences, and give thanks unto the Lord in his prayer.

verses.name: Sirach 39:7
verses.text: He shall direct his counsel and knowledge, and in his secrets shall he meditate.

verses.name: Sirach 39:8
verses.text: He shall shew forth that which he hath learned, and shall glory in the law of the covenant of the Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 39:9
verses.text: Many shall commend his understanding; and so long as the world endureth, it shall not be blotted out; his memorial shall not depart away, and his name shall live from generation to generation.

verses.name: Sirach 39:10
verses.text: Nations shall shew forth his wisdom, and the congregation shall declare his praise.

verses.name: Sirach 39:11
verses.text: If he die, he shall leave a greater name than a thousand: and if he live, he shall increase it.

verses.name: Sirach 39:12
verses.text: Yet have I more to say, which I have thought upon; for I am filled as the moon at the full.

verses.name: Sirach 39:13
verses.text: Hearken unto me, ye holy children, and bud forth as a rose growing by the brook of the field:

verses.name: Sirach 39:14
verses.text: And give ye a sweet savour as frankincense, and flourish as a lily, send forth a smell, and sing a song of praise, bless the Lord in all his works.

verses.name: Sirach 39:15
verses.text: Magnify his name, and shew forth his praise with the songs of your lips, and with harps, and in praising him ye shall say after this manner:

verses.name: Sirach 39:16
verses.text: All the works of the Lord are exceeding good, and whatsoever he commandeth shall be accomplished in due season.

verses.name: Sirach 39:17
verses.text: And none may say, What is this? wherefore is that? for at time convenient they shall all be sought out: at his commandment the waters stood as an heap, and at the words of his mouth the receptacles of waters.

verses.name: Sirach 39:18
verses.text: At his commandment is done whatsoever pleaseth him; and none can hinder, when he will save.

verses.name: Sirach 39:19
verses.text: The works of all flesh are before him, and nothing can be hid from his eyes.

verses.name: Sirach 39:20
verses.text: He seeth from everlasting to everlasting; and there is nothing wonderful before him.

verses.name: Sirach 39:21
verses.text: A man need not to say, What is this? wherefore is that? for he hath made all things for their uses.

verses.name: Sirach 39:22
verses.text: His blessing covered the dry land as a river, and watered it as a flood.

verses.name: Sirach 39:23
verses.text: As he hath turned the waters into saltness: so shall the heathen inherit his wrath.

verses.name: Sirach 39:24
verses.text: As his ways are plain unto the holy; so are they stumblingblocks unto the wicked.

verses.name: Sirach 39:25
verses.text: For the good are good things created from the beginning: so evil things for sinners.

verses.name: Sirach 39:26
verses.text: The principal things for the whole use of manâ€™s life are water, fire, iron, and salt, flour of wheat, honey, milk, and the blood of the grape, and oil, and clothing.

verses.name: Sirach 39:27
verses.text: All these things are for good to the godly: so to the sinners they are turned into evil.

verses.name: Sirach 39:28
verses.text: There be spirits that are created for vengeance, which in their fury lay on sore strokes; in the time of destruction they pour out their force, and appease the wrath of him that made them.

verses.name: Sirach 39:29
verses.text: Fire, and hail, and famine, and death, all these were created for vengeance;

verses.name: Sirach 39:30
verses.text: Teeth of wild beasts, and scorpions, serpents, and the sword punishing the wicked to destruction.

verses.name: Sirach 39:31
verses.text: They shall rejoice in his commandment, and they shall be ready upon earth, when need is; and when their time is come, they shall not transgress his word.

verses.name: Sirach 39:32
verses.text: Therefore from the beginning I was resolved, and thought upon these things, and have left them in writing.

verses.name: Sirach 39:33
verses.text: All the works of the Lord are good: and he will give every needful thing in due season.

verses.name: Sirach 39:34
verses.text: So that a man cannot say, This is worse than that: for in time they shall all be well approved.

verses.name: Sirach 39:35
verses.text: And therefore praise ye the Lord with the whole heart and mouth, and bless the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 40:1
verses.text: Great travail is created for every man, and an heavy yoke is upon the sons of Adam, from the day that they go out of their motherâ€™s womb, till the day that they return to the mother of all things.

verses.name: Sirach 40:2
verses.text: Their imagination of things to come, and the day of death, trouble their thoughts, and cause fear of heart;

verses.name: Sirach 40:3
verses.text: From him that sitteth on a throne of glory, unto him that is humbled in earth and ashes;

verses.name: Sirach 40:4
verses.text: From him that weareth purple and a crown, unto him that is clothed with a linen frock.

verses.name: Sirach 40:5
verses.text: Wrath, and envy, trouble, and unquietness, fear of death, and anger, and strife, and in the time of rest upon his bed his night sleep, do change his knowledge.

verses.name: Sirach 40:6
verses.text: A little or nothing is his rest, and afterward he is in his sleep, as in a day of keeping watch, troubled in the vision of his heart, as if he were escaped out of a battle.

verses.name: Sirach 40:7
verses.text: When all is safe, he awaketh, and marvelleth that the fear was nothing.

verses.name: Sirach 40:8
verses.text: Such things happen unto all flesh, both man and beast, and that is sevenfold more upon sinners.

verses.name: Sirach 40:9
verses.text: Death, and bloodshed, strife, and sword, calamities, famine, tribulation, and the scourge;

verses.name: Sirach 40:10
verses.text: These things are created for the wicked, and for their sakes came the flood.

verses.name: Sirach 40:11
verses.text: All things that are of the earth shall turn to the earth again: and that which is of the waters doth return into the sea.

verses.name: Sirach 40:12
verses.text: All bribery and injustice shall be blotted out: but true dealing shall endure for ever.

verses.name: Sirach 40:13
verses.text: The goods of the unjust shall be dried up like a river, and shall vanish with noise, like a great thunder in rain.

verses.name: Sirach 40:14
verses.text: While he openeth his hand he shall rejoice: so shall transgressors come to nought.

verses.name: Sirach 40:15
verses.text: The children of the ungodly shall not bring forth many branches: but are as unclean roots upon a hard rock.

verses.name: Sirach 40:16
verses.text: The weed growing upon every water and bank of a river shall be pulled up before all grass.

verses.name: Sirach 40:17
verses.text: Bountifulness is as a most fruitful garden, and mercifulness endureth for ever.

verses.name: Sirach 40:18
verses.text: To labour, and to be content with that a man hath, is a sweet life: but he that findeth a treasure is above them both.

verses.name: Sirach 40:19
verses.text: Children and the building of a city continue a manâ€™s name: but a blameless wife is counted above them both.

verses.name: Sirach 40:20
verses.text: Wine and musick rejoice the heart: but the love of wisdom is above them both.

verses.name: Sirach 40:21
verses.text: The pipe and the psaltery make sweet melody: but a pleasant tongue is above them both.

verses.name: Sirach 40:22
verses.text: Thine eye desireth favour and beauty: but more than both corn while it is green.

verses.name: Sirach 40:23
verses.text: A friend and companion never meet amiss: but above both is a wife with her husband.

verses.name: Sirach 40:24
verses.text: Brethren and help are against time of trouble: but alms shall deliver more than them both.

verses.name: Sirach 40:25
verses.text: Gold and silver make the foot stand sure: but counsel is esteemed above them both.

verses.name: Sirach 40:26
verses.text: Riches and strength lift up the heart: but the fear of the Lord is above them both: there is no want in the fear of the Lord, and it needeth not to seek help.

verses.name: Sirach 40:27
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is a fruitful garden, and covereth him above all glory.

verses.name: Sirach 40:28
verses.text: My son, lead not a beggarâ€™s life; for better it is to die than to beg.

verses.name: Sirach 40:29
verses.text: The life of him that dependeth on another manâ€™s table is not to be counted for a life; for he polluteth himself with other menâ€™s meat: but a wise man well nurtured will beware thereof.

verses.name: Sirach 40:30
verses.text: Begging is sweet in the mouth of the shameless: but in his belly there shall burn a fire.

verses.name: Sirach 41:1
verses.text: O death, how bitter is the remembrance of thee to a man that liveth at rest in his possessions, unto the man that hath nothing to vex him, and that hath prosperity in all things: yea, unto him that is yet able to receive meat!

verses.name: Sirach 41:2
verses.text: O death, acceptable is thy sentence unto the needy, and unto him whose strength faileth, that is now in the last age, and is vexed with all things, and to him that despaireth, and hath lost patience!

verses.name: Sirach 41:3
verses.text: Fear not the sentence of death, remember them that have been before thee, and that come after; for this is the sentence of the Lord over all flesh.

verses.name: Sirach 41:4
verses.text: And why art thou against the pleasure of the most High? there is no inquisition in the grave, whether thou have lived ten, or an hundred, or a thousand years.

verses.name: Sirach 41:5
verses.text: The children of sinners are abominable children, and they that are conversant in the dwelling of the ungodly.

verses.name: Sirach 41:6
verses.text: The inheritance of sinnersâ€™ children shall perish, and their posterity shall have a perpetual reproach.

verses.name: Sirach 41:7
verses.text: The children will complain of an ungodly father, because they shall be reproached for his sake.

verses.name: Sirach 41:8
verses.text: Woe be unto you, ungodly men, which have forsaken the law of the most high God! for if ye increase, it shall be to your destruction:

verses.name: Sirach 41:9
verses.text: And if ye be born, ye shall be born to a curse: and if ye die, a curse shall be your portion.

verses.name: Sirach 41:10
verses.text: All that are of the earth shall turn to earth again: so the ungodly shall go from a curse to destruction.

verses.name: Sirach 41:11
verses.text: The mourning of men is about their bodies: but an ill name of sinners shall be blotted out.

verses.name: Sirach 41:12
verses.text: Have regard to thy name; for that shall continue with thee above a thousand great treasures of gold.

verses.name: Sirach 41:13
verses.text: A good life hath but few days: but a good name endureth for ever.

verses.name: Sirach 41:14
verses.text: My children, keep discipline in peace: for wisdom that is hid, and a treasure that is not seen, what profit is in them both?

verses.name: Sirach 41:15
verses.text: A man that hideth his foolishness is better than a man that hideth his wisdom.

verses.name: Sirach 41:16
verses.text: Therefore be shamefaced according to my word: for it is not good to retain all shamefacedness; neither is it altogether approved in every thing.

verses.name: Sirach 41:17
verses.text: Be ashamed of whoredom before father and mother: and of a lie before a prince and a mighty man;

verses.name: Sirach 41:18
verses.text: Of an offence before a judge and ruler; of iniquity before a congregation and people; of unjust dealing before thy partner and friend;

verses.name: Sirach 41:19
verses.text: And of theft in regard of the place where thou sojournest, and in regard of the truth of God and his covenant; and to lean with thine elbow upon the meat; and of scorning to give and take;

verses.name: Sirach 41:20
verses.text: And of silence before them that salute thee; and to look upon an harlot;

verses.name: Sirach 41:21
verses.text: And to turn away thy face from thy kinsman; or to take away a portion or a gift; or to gaze upon another manâ€™s wife.

verses.name: Sirach 41:22
verses.text: Or to be overbusy with his maid, and come not near her bed; or of upbraiding speeches before friends; and after thou hast given, upbraid not;

verses.name: Sirach 41:23
verses.text: Or of iterating and speaking again that which thou hast heard; and of revealing of secrets.

verses.name: Sirach 41:24
verses.text: So shalt thou be truly shamefaced and find favour before all men.

verses.name: Sirach 42:1
verses.text: Of these things be not thou ashamed, and accept no person to sin thereby:

verses.name: Sirach 42:2
verses.text: Of the law of the most High, and his covenant; and of judgment to justify the ungodly;

verses.name: Sirach 42:3
verses.text: Of reckoning with thy partners and travellers; or of the gift of the heritage of friends;

verses.name: Sirach 42:4
verses.text: Of exactness of balance and weights; or of getting much or little;

verses.name: Sirach 42:5
verses.text: And of merchantsâ€™ indifferent selling; of much correction of children; and to make the side of an evil servant to bleed.

verses.name: Sirach 42:6
verses.text: Sure keeping is good, where an evil wife is; and shut up, where many hands are.

verses.name: Sirach 42:7
verses.text: Deliver all things in number and weight; and put all in writing that thou givest out, or receivest in.

verses.name: Sirach 42:8
verses.text: Be not ashamed to inform the unwise and foolish, and the extreme aged that contendeth with those that are young: thus shalt thou be truly learned, and approved of all men living.

verses.name: Sirach 42:9
verses.text: The father waketh for the daughter, when no man knoweth; and the care for her taketh away sleep: when she is young, lest she pass away the flower of her age; and being married, lest she should be hated:

verses.name: Sirach 42:10
verses.text: In her virginity, lest she should be defiled and gotten with child in her fatherâ€™s house; and having an husband, lest she should misbehave herself; and when she is married, lest she should be barren.

verses.name: Sirach 42:11
verses.text: Keep a sure watch over a shameless daughter, lest she make thee a laughingstock to thine enemies, and a byword in the city, and a reproach among the people, and make thee ashamed before the multitude.

verses.name: Sirach 42:12
verses.text: Behold not every bodyâ€™s beauty, and sit not in the midst of women.

verses.name: Sirach 42:13
verses.text: For from garments cometh a moth, and from women wickedness.

verses.name: Sirach 42:14
verses.text: Better is the churlishness of a man than a courteous woman, a woman, I say, which bringeth shame and reproach.

verses.name: Sirach 42:15
verses.text: I will now remember the works of the Lord, and declare the things that I have seen: In the words of the Lord are his works.

verses.name: Sirach 42:16
verses.text: The sun that giveth light looketh upon all things, and the work thereof is full of the glory of the Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 42:17
verses.text: The Lord hath not given power to the saints to declare all his marvellous works, which the Almighty Lord firmly settled, that whatsoever is might be established for his glory.

verses.name: Sirach 42:18
verses.text: He seeketh out the deep, and the heart, and considereth their crafty devices: for the Lord knoweth all that may be known, and he beholdeth the signs of the world.

verses.name: Sirach 42:19
verses.text: He declareth the things that are past, and for to come, and revealeth the steps of hidden things.

verses.name: Sirach 42:20
verses.text: No thought escapeth him, neither any word is hidden from him.

verses.name: Sirach 42:21
verses.text: He hath garnished the excellent works of his wisdom, and he is from everlasting to everlasting: unto him may nothing be added, neither can he be diminished, and he hath no need of any counsellor.

verses.name: Sirach 42:22
verses.text: Oh how desirable are all his works! and that a man may see even to a spark.

verses.name: Sirach 42:23
verses.text: All these things live and remain for ever for all uses, and they are all obedient.

verses.name: Sirach 42:24
verses.text: All things are double one against another: and he hath made nothing imperfect.

verses.name: Sirach 42:25
verses.text: One thing establisheth the good or another: and who shall be filled with beholding his glory?

verses.name: Sirach 43:1
verses.text: The pride of the height, the clear firmament, the beauty of heaven, with his glorious shew;

verses.name: Sirach 43:2
verses.text: The sun when it appeareth, declaring at his rising a marvellous instrument, the work of the most High:

verses.name: Sirach 43:3
verses.text: At noon it parcheth the country, and who can abide the burning heat thereof?

verses.name: Sirach 43:4
verses.text: A man blowing a furnace is in works of heat, but the sun burneth the mountains three times more; breathing out fiery vapours, and sending forth bright beams, it dimmeth the eyes.

verses.name: Sirach 43:5
verses.text: Great is the Lord that made it; and at his commandment runneth hastily.

verses.name: Sirach 43:6
verses.text: He made the moon also to serve in her season for a declaration of times, and a sign of the world.

verses.name: Sirach 43:7
verses.text: From the moon is the sign of feasts, a light that decreaseth in her perfection.

verses.name: Sirach 43:8
verses.text: The month is called after her name, increasing wonderfully in her changing, being an instrument of the armies above, shining in the firmament of heaven;

verses.name: Sirach 43:9
verses.text: The beauty of heaven, the glory of the stars, an ornament giving light in the highest places of the Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 43:10
verses.text: At the commandment of the Holy One they will stand in their order, and never faint in their watches.

verses.name: Sirach 43:11
verses.text: Look upon the rainbow, and praise him that made it; very beautiful it is in the brightness thereof.

verses.name: Sirach 43:12
verses.text: It compasseth the heaven about with a glorious circle, and the hands of the most High have bended it.

verses.name: Sirach 43:13
verses.text: By his commandment he maketh the snow to fall aplace, and sendeth swiftly the lightnings of his judgment.

verses.name: Sirach 43:14
verses.text: Through this the treasures are opened: and clouds fly forth as fowls.

verses.name: Sirach 43:15
verses.text: By his great power he maketh the clouds firm, and the hailstones are broken small.

verses.name: Sirach 43:16
verses.text: At his sight the mountains are shaken, and at his will the south wind bloweth.

verses.name: Sirach 43:17
verses.text: The noise of the thunder maketh the earth to tremble: so doth the northern storm and the whirlwind: as birds flying he scattereth the snow, and the falling down thereof is as the lighting of grasshoppers:

verses.name: Sirach 43:18
verses.text: The eye marvelleth at the beauty of the whiteness thereof, and the heart is astonished at the raining of it.

verses.name: Sirach 43:19
verses.text: The hoarfrost also as salt he poureth on the earth, and being congealed, it lieth on the top of sharp stakes.

verses.name: Sirach 43:20
verses.text: When the cold north wind bloweth, and the water is congealed into ice, it abideth upon every gathering together of water, and clotheth the water as with a breastplate.

verses.name: Sirach 43:21
verses.text: It devoureth the mountains, and burneth the wilderness, and consumeth the grass as fire.

verses.name: Sirach 43:22
verses.text: A present remedy of all is a mist coming speedily, a dew coming after heat refresheth.

verses.name: Sirach 43:23
verses.text: By his counsel he appeaseth the deep, and planteth islands therein.

verses.name: Sirach 43:24
verses.text: They that sail on the sea tell of the danger thereof; and when we hear it with our ears, we marvel thereat.

verses.name: Sirach 43:25
verses.text: For therein be strange and wondrous works, variety of all kinds of beasts and whales created.

verses.name: Sirach 43:26
verses.text: By him the end of them hath prosperous success, and by his word all things consist.

verses.name: Sirach 43:27
verses.text: We may speak much, and yet come short: wherefore in sum, he is all.

verses.name: Sirach 43:28
verses.text: How shall we be able to magnify him? for he is great above all his works.

verses.name: Sirach 43:29
verses.text: The Lord is terrible and very great, and marvellous is his power.

verses.name: Sirach 43:30
verses.text: When ye glorify the Lord, exalt him as much as ye can; for even yet will he far exceed: and when ye exalt him, put forth all your strength, and be not weary; for ye can never go far enough.

verses.name: Sirach 43:31
verses.text: Who hath seen him, that he might tell us? and who can magnify him as he is?

verses.name: Sirach 43:32
verses.text: There are yet hid greater things than these be, for we have seen but a few of his works.

verses.name: Sirach 43:33
verses.text: For the Lord hath made all things; and to the godly hath he given wisdom.

verses.name: Sirach 44:1
verses.text: Let us now praise famous men, and our fathers that begat us.

verses.name: Sirach 44:2
verses.text: The Lord hath wrought great glory by them through his great power from the beginning.

verses.name: Sirach 44:3
verses.text: Such as did bear rule in their kingdoms, men renowned for their power, giving counsel by their understanding, and declaring prophecies:

verses.name: Sirach 44:4
verses.text: Leaders of the people by their counsels, and by their knowledge of learning meet for the people, wise and eloquent are their instructions:

verses.name: Sirach 44:5
verses.text: Such as found out musical tunes, and recited verses in writing:

verses.name: Sirach 44:6
verses.text: Rich men furnished with ability, living peaceably in their habitations:

verses.name: Sirach 44:7
verses.text: All these were honoured in their generations, and were the glory of their times.

verses.name: Sirach 44:8
verses.text: There be of them, that have left a name behind them, that their praises might be reported.

verses.name: Sirach 44:9
verses.text: And some there be, which have no memorial; who are perished, as though they had never been; and are become as though they had never been born; and their children after them.

verses.name: Sirach 44:10
verses.text: But these were merciful men, whose righteousness hath not been forgotten.

verses.name: Sirach 44:11
verses.text: With their seed shall continually remain a good inheritance, and their children are within the covenant.

verses.name: Sirach 44:12
verses.text: Their seed standeth fast, and their children for their sakes.

verses.name: Sirach 44:13
verses.text: Their seed shall remain for ever, and their glory shall not be blotted out.

verses.name: Sirach 44:14
verses.text: Their bodies are buried in peace; but their name liveth for evermore.

verses.name: Sirach 44:15
verses.text: The people will tell of their wisdom, and the congregation will shew forth their praise.

verses.name: Sirach 44:16
verses.text: Enoch pleased the Lord, and was translated, being an example of repentance to all generations.

verses.name: Sirach 44:17
verses.text: Noah was found perfect and righteous; in the time of wrath he was taken in exchange for the world; therefore was he left as a remnant unto the earth, when the flood came.

verses.name: Sirach 44:18
verses.text: An everlasting covenant was made with him, that all flesh should perish no more by the flood.

verses.name: Sirach 44:19
verses.text: Abraham was a great father of many people: in glory was there none like unto him;

verses.name: Sirach 44:20
verses.text: Who kept the law of the most High, and was in covenant with him: he established the covenant in his flesh; and when he was proved, he was found faithful.

verses.name: Sirach 44:21
verses.text: Therefore he assured him by an oath, that he would bless the nations in his seed, and that he would multiply him as the dust of the earth, and exalt his seed as the stars, and cause them to inherit from sea to sea, and from the river unto the utmost part of the land.

verses.name: Sirach 44:22
verses.text: With Isaac did he establish likewise for Abraham his fatherâ€™s sake the blessing of all men, and the covenant, And made it rest upon the head of Jacob. He acknowledged him in his blessing, and gave him an heritage, and divided his portions; among the twelve tribes did he part them.

verses.name: Sirach 45:1
verses.text: And he brought out of him a merciful man, which found favour in the sight of all flesh, even Moses, beloved of God and men, whose memorial is blessed.

verses.name: Sirach 45:2
verses.text: He made him like to the glorious saints, and magnified him, so that his enemies stood in fear of him.

verses.name: Sirach 45:3
verses.text: By his words he caused the wonders to cease, and he made him glorious in the sight of kings, and gave him a commandment for his people, and shewed him part of his glory.

verses.name: Sirach 45:4
verses.text: He sanctified him in his faithfuless and meekness, and chose him out of all men.

verses.name: Sirach 45:5
verses.text: He made him to hear his voice, and brought him into the dark cloud, and gave him commandments before his face, even the law of life and knowledge, that he might teach Jacob his covenants, and Israel his judgments.

verses.name: Sirach 45:6
verses.text: He exalted Aaron, an holy man like unto him, even his brother, of the tribe of Levi.

verses.name: Sirach 45:7
verses.text: An everlasting covenant he made with him and gave him the priesthood among the people; he beautified him with comely ornaments, and clothed him with a robe of glory.

verses.name: Sirach 45:8
verses.text: He put upon him perfect glory; and strengthened him with rich garments, with breeches, with a long robe, and the ephod.

verses.name: Sirach 45:9
verses.text: And he compassed him with pomegranates, and with many golden bells round about, that as he went there might be a sound, and a noise made that might be heard in the temple, for a memorial to the children of his people;

verses.name: Sirach 45:10
verses.text: With an holy garment, with gold, and blue silk, and purple, the work of the embroidere, with a breastplate of judgment, and with Urim and Thummim;

verses.name: Sirach 45:11
verses.text: With twisted scarlet, the work of the cunning workman, with precious stones graven like seals, and set in gold, the work of the jeweller, with a writing engraved for a memorial, after the number of the tribes of Israel.

verses.name: Sirach 45:12
verses.text: He set a crown of gold upon the mitre, wherein was engraved Holiness, an ornament of honour, a costly work, the desires of the eyes, goodly and beautiful.

verses.name: Sirach 45:13
verses.text: Before him there were none such, neither did ever any stranger put them on, but only his children and his childrenâ€™s children perpetually.

verses.name: Sirach 45:14
verses.text: Their sacrifices shall be wholly consumed every day twice continually.

verses.name: Sirach 45:15
verses.text: Moses consecrated him, and anointed him with holy oil: this was appointed unto him by an everlasting covenant, and to his seed, so long as the heavens should remain, that they should minister unto him, and execute the office of the priesthood, and bless the people in his name.

verses.name: Sirach 45:16
verses.text: He chose him out of all men living to offer sacrifices to the Lord, incense, and a sweet savour, for a memorial, to make reconciliation for his people.

verses.name: Sirach 45:17
verses.text: He gave unto him his commandments, and authority in the statutes of judgments, that he should teach Jacob the testimonies, and inform Israel in his laws.

verses.name: Sirach 45:18
verses.text: Strangers conspired together against him, and maligned him in the wilderness, even the men that were of Dathanâ€™s and Abironâ€™s side, and the congregation of Core, with fury and wrath.

verses.name: Sirach 45:19
verses.text: This the Lord saw, and it displeased him, and in his wrathful indignation were they consumed: he did wonders upon them, to consume them with the fiery flame.

verses.name: Sirach 45:20
verses.text: But he made Aaron more honourable, and gave him an heritage, and divided unto him the firstfruits of the increase; especially he prepared bread in abundance:

verses.name: Sirach 45:21
verses.text: For they eat of the sacrifices of the Lord, which he gave unto him and his seed.

verses.name: Sirach 45:22
verses.text: Howbeit in the land of the people he had no inheritance, neither had he any portion among the people: for the Lord himself is his portion and inheritance.

verses.name: Sirach 45:23
verses.text: The third in glory is Phinees the son of Eleazar, because he had zeal in the fear of the Lord, and stood up with good courage of heart: when the people were turned back, and made reconciliation for Israel.

verses.name: Sirach 45:24
verses.text: Therefore was there a covenant of peace made with him, that he should be the chief of the sanctuary and of his people, and that he and his posterity should have the dignity of the priesthood for ever:

verses.name: Sirach 45:25
verses.text: According to the covenant made with David son of Jesse, of the tribe of Juda, that the inheritance of the king should be to his posterity alone: so the inheritance of Aaron should also be unto his seed.

verses.name: Sirach 45:26
verses.text: God give you wisdom in your heart to judge his people in righteousness, that their good things be not abolished, and that their glory may endure for ever.

verses.name: Sirach 46:1
verses.text: Jesus the son a Nave was valiant in the wars, and was the successor of Moses in prophecies, who according to his name was made great for the saving of the elect of God, and taking vengeance of the enemies that rose up against them, that he might set Israel in their inheritance.

verses.name: Sirach 46:2
verses.text: How great glory gat he, when he did lift up his hands, and stretched out his sword against the cities!

verses.name: Sirach 46:3
verses.text: Who before him so stood to it? for the Lord himself brought his enemies unto him.

verses.name: Sirach 46:4
verses.text: Did not the sun go back by his means? and was not one day as long as two?

verses.name: Sirach 46:5
verses.text: He called upon the most high Lord, when the enemies pressed upon him on every side; and the great Lord heard him.

verses.name: Sirach 46:6
verses.text: And with hailstones of mighty power he made the battle to fall violently upon the nations, and in the descent of Beth-horon he destroyed them that resisted, that the nations might know all their strength, because he fought in the sight of the Lord, and he followed the Mighty One.

verses.name: Sirach 46:7
verses.text: In the time of Moses also he did a work of mercy, he and Caleb the son of Jephunne, in that they withstood the congregation, and withheld the people from sin, and appeased the wicked murmuring.

verses.name: Sirach 46:8
verses.text: And of six hundred thousand people on foot, they two were preserved to bring them in to the heritage, even unto the land that floweth with milk and honey.

verses.name: Sirach 46:9
verses.text: The Lord gave strength also unto Caleb, which remained with him unto his old age: so that he entered upon the high places of the land, and his seed obtained it for an heritage:

verses.name: Sirach 46:10
verses.text: That all the children of Israel might see that it is good to follow the Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 46:11
verses.text: And concerning the judges, every one by name, whose heart went not a whoring, nor departed from the Lord, let their memory be blessed.

verses.name: Sirach 46:12
verses.text: Let their bones flourish out of their place, and let the name of them that were honoured be continued upon their children.

verses.name: Sirach 46:13
verses.text: Samuel, the prophet of the Lord, beloved of his Lord, established a kingdom, and anointed princes over his people.

verses.name: Sirach 46:14
verses.text: By the law of the Lord he judged the congregation, and the Lord had respect unto Jacob.

verses.name: Sirach 46:15
verses.text: By his faithfulness he was found a true prophet, and by his word he was known to be faithful in vision.

verses.name: Sirach 46:16
verses.text: He called upon the mighty Lord, when his enemies pressed upon him on every side, when he offered the sucking lamb.

verses.name: Sirach 46:17
verses.text: And the Lord thundered from heaven, and with a great noise made his voice to be heard.

verses.name: Sirach 46:18
verses.text: And he destroyed the rulers of the Tyrians, and all the princes cf the Philistines.

verses.name: Sirach 46:19
verses.text: And before his long sleep he made protestations in the sight of the Lord and his anointed, I have not taken any manâ€™s goods, so much as a shoe: and no man did accuse him.

verses.name: Sirach 46:20
verses.text: And after his death he prophesied, and shewed the king his end, and lifted up his voice from the earth in prophecy, to blot out the wickedness of the people.

verses.name: Sirach 47:1
verses.text: And after him rose up Nathan to prophesy in the time of David.

verses.name: Sirach 47:2
verses.text: As is the fat taken away from the peace offering, so was David chosen out of the children of Israel.

verses.name: Sirach 47:3
verses.text: He played with lions as with kids, and with bears as with lambs.

verses.name: Sirach 47:4
verses.text: Slew he not a giant, when he was yet but young? and did he not take away reproach from the people, when he lifted up his hand with the stone in the sling, and beat down the boasting of Goliath?

verses.name: Sirach 47:5
verses.text: For he called upon the most high Lord; and he gave him strength in his right hand to slay that mighty warrior, and set up the horn of his people.

verses.name: Sirach 47:6
verses.text: So the people honoured him with ten thousands, and praised him in the blessings of the Lord, in that he gave him a crown of glory.

verses.name: Sirach 47:7
verses.text: For he destroyed the enemies on every side, and brought to nought the Philistines his adversaries, and brake their horn in sunder unto this day.

verses.name: Sirach 47:8
verses.text: In all his works he praised the Holy One most high with words of glory; with his whole heart he sung songs, and loved him that made him.

verses.name: Sirach 47:9
verses.text: He set singers also before the altar, that by their voices they might make sweet melody, and daily sing praises in their songs.

verses.name: Sirach 47:10
verses.text: He beautified their feasts, and set in order the solemn times until the end, that they might praise his holy name, and that the temple might sound from morning.

verses.name: Sirach 47:11
verses.text: The Lord took away his sins, and exalted his horn for ever: he gave him a covenant of kings, and a throne of glory in Israel.

verses.name: Sirach 47:12
verses.text: After him rose up a wise son, and for his sake he dwelt at large.

verses.name: Sirach 47:13
verses.text: Solomon reigned in a peaceable time, and was honoured; for God made all quiet round about him, that he might build an house in his name, and prepare his sanctuary for ever.

verses.name: Sirach 47:14
verses.text: How wise wast thou in thy youth and, as a flood, filled with understanding!

verses.name: Sirach 47:15
verses.text: Thy soul covered the whole earth, and thou filledst it with dark parables.

verses.name: Sirach 47:16
verses.text: Thy name went far unto the islands; and for thy peace thou wast beloved.

verses.name: Sirach 47:17
verses.text: The countries marvelled at thee for thy songs, and proverbs, and parables, and interpretations.

verses.name: Sirach 47:18
verses.text: By the name of the Lord God, which is called the Lord God of Israel, thou didst gather gold as tin and didst multiply silver as lead.

verses.name: Sirach 47:19
verses.text: Thou didst bow thy loins unto women, and by thy body thou wast brought into subjection.

verses.name: Sirach 47:20
verses.text: Thou didst stain thy honour, and pollute thy seed: so that thou broughtest wrath upon thy children, and wast grieved for thy folly.

verses.name: Sirach 47:21
verses.text: So the kingdom was divided, and out of Ephraim ruled a rebellious kingdom.

verses.name: Sirach 47:22
verses.text: But the Lord will never leave off his mercy, neither shall any of his works perish, neither will he abolish the posterity of his elect, and the seed of him that loveth him he will not take away: wherefore he gave a remnant unto Jacob, and out of him a root unto David.

verses.name: Sirach 47:23
verses.text: Thus rested Solomon with his fathers, and of his seed he left behind him Roboam, even the foolishness of the people, and one that had no understanding, who turned away the people through his counsel. There was also Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who caused Israel to sin, and shewed Ephraim the way of sin:

verses.name: Sirach 47:24
verses.text: And their sins were multiplied exceedingly, that they were driven out of the land.

verses.name: Sirach 47:25
verses.text: For they sought out all wickedness, till the vengeance came upon them.

verses.name: Sirach 48:1
verses.text: Then stood up Elias the prophet as fire, and his word burned like a lamp.

verses.name: Sirach 48:2
verses.text: He brought a sore famine upon them, and by his zeal he diminished their number.

verses.name: Sirach 48:3
verses.text: By the word of the Lord he shut up the heaven, and also three times brought down fire.

verses.name: Sirach 48:4
verses.text: O Elias, how wast thou honoured in thy wondrous deeds! and who may glory like unto thee!

verses.name: Sirach 48:5
verses.text: Who didst raise up a dead man from death, and his soul from the place of the dead, by the word of the most High:

verses.name: Sirach 48:6
verses.text: Who broughtest kings to destruction, and honorable men from their bed:

verses.name: Sirach 48:7
verses.text: Who heardest the rebuke of the Lord in Sinai, and in Horeb the judgment of vengeance:

verses.name: Sirach 48:8
verses.text: Who annointedst kings to take revenge, and prophets to succeed after him:

verses.name: Sirach 48:9
verses.text: Who was taken up in a whirlwind of fire, and in a chariot of fiery horses:

verses.name: Sirach 48:10
verses.text: Who wast ordained for reproofs in their times, to pacify the wrath of the Lordâ€™s judgment, before it brake forth into fury, and to turn the heart of the father unto the son, and to restore the tribes of Jacob.

verses.name: Sirach 48:11
verses.text: Blessed are they that saw thee, and slept in love; for we shall surely live.

verses.name: Sirach 48:12
verses.text: Elias it was, who was covered with a whirlwind: and Eliseus was filled with his spirit: whilst he lived, he was not moved with the presence of any prince, neither could any bring him into subjection.

verses.name: Sirach 48:13
verses.text: No word could overcome him; and after his death his body prophesied.

verses.name: Sirach 48:14
verses.text: He did wonders in his life, and at his death were his works marvellous.

verses.name: Sirach 48:15
verses.text: For all this the people repented not, neither departed they from their sins, till they were spoiled and carried out of their land, and were scattered through all the earth: yet there remained a small people, and a ruler in the house of David:

verses.name: Sirach 48:16
verses.text: Of whom some did that which was pleasing to God, and some multiplied sins.

verses.name: Sirach 48:17
verses.text: Ezekias fortified his city, and brought in water into the midst thereof: he digged the hard rock with iron, and made wells for waters.

verses.name: Sirach 48:18
verses.text: In his time Sennacherib came up, and sent Rabsaces, and lifted up his hand against Sion, and boasted proudly.

verses.name: Sirach 48:19
verses.text: Then trembled their hearts and hands, and they were in pain, as women in travail.

verses.name: Sirach 48:20
verses.text: But they called upon the Lord which is merciful, and stretched out their hands toward him: and immediately the Holy One heard them out of heaven, and delivered them by the ministry of Esay.

verses.name: Sirach 48:21
verses.text: He smote the host of the Assyrians, and his angel destroyed them.

verses.name: Sirach 48:22
verses.text: For Ezekias had done the thing that pleased the Lord, and was strong in the ways of David his father, as Esay the prophet, who was great and faithful in his vision, had commanded him.

verses.name: Sirach 48:23
verses.text: In his time the sun went backward, and he lengthened the kingâ€™s life.

verses.name: Sirach 48:24
verses.text: He saw by an excellent spirit what should come to pass at the last, and he comforted them that mourned in Sion.

verses.name: Sirach 48:25
verses.text: He shewed what should come to pass for ever, and secret things or ever they came.

verses.name: Sirach 49:1
verses.text: The remembrance of Josias is like the composition of the perfume that is made by the art of the apothecary: it is sweet as honey in all mouths, and as musick at a banquet of wine.

verses.name: Sirach 49:2
verses.text: He behaved himself uprightly in the conversion of the people, and took away the abominations of iniquity.

verses.name: Sirach 49:3
verses.text: He directed his heart unto the Lord, and in the time of the ungodly he established the worship of God.

verses.name: Sirach 49:4
verses.text: All, except David and Ezekias and Josias, were defective: for they forsook the law of the most High, even the kings of Juda failed.

verses.name: Sirach 49:5
verses.text: Therefore he gave their power unto others, and their glory to a strange nation.

verses.name: Sirach 49:6
verses.text: They burnt the chosen city of the sanctuary, and made the streets desolate, according to the prophecy of Jeremias.

verses.name: Sirach 49:7
verses.text: For they entreated him evil, who nevertheless was a prophet, sanctified in his motherâ€™s womb, that he might root out, and afflict, and destroy; and that he might build up also, and plant.

verses.name: Sirach 49:8
verses.text: It was Ezekiel who saw the glorious vision, which was shewed him upon the chariot of the cherubims.

verses.name: Sirach 49:9
verses.text: For he made mention of the enemies under the figure of the rain, and directed them that went right.

verses.name: Sirach 49:10
verses.text: And of the twelve prophets let the memorial be blessed, and let their bones flourish again out of their place: for they comforted Jacob, and delivered them by assured hope.

verses.name: Sirach 49:11
verses.text: How shall we magnify Zorobabel? even he was as a signet on the right hand:

verses.name: Sirach 49:12
verses.text: So was Jesus the son of Josedec: who in their time builded the house, and set up an holy temple to the Lord, which was prepared for everlasting glory.

verses.name: Sirach 49:13
verses.text: And among the elect was Neemias, whose renown is great, who raised up for us the walls that were fallen, and set up the gates and the bars, and raised up our ruins again.

verses.name: Sirach 49:14
verses.text: But upon the earth was no man created like Enoch; for he was taken from the earth.

verses.name: Sirach 49:15
verses.text: Neither was there a young man born like Joseph, a governor of his brethren, a stay of the people, whose bones were regarded of the Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 49:16
verses.text: Sem and Seth were in great honour among men, and so was Adam above every living thing in creation.

verses.name: Sirach 50:1
verses.text: Simon the high priest, the son of Onias, who in his life repaired the house again, and in his days fortified the temple:

verses.name: Sirach 50:2
verses.text: And by him was built from the foundation the double height, the high fortress of the wall about the temple:

verses.name: Sirach 50:3
verses.text: In his days the cistern to receive water, being in compass as the sea, was covered with plates of brass:

verses.name: Sirach 50:4
verses.text: He took care of the temple that it should not fall, and fortified the city against besieging:

verses.name: Sirach 50:5
verses.text: How was he honoured in the midst of the people in his coming out of the sanctuary!

verses.name: Sirach 50:6
verses.text: He was as the morning star in the midst of a cloud, and as the moon at the full:

verses.name: Sirach 50:7
verses.text: As the sun shining upon the temple of the most High, and as the rainbow giving light in the bright clouds:

verses.name: Sirach 50:8
verses.text: And as the flower of roses in the spring of the year, as lilies by the rivers of waters, and as the branches of the frankincense tree in the time of summer:

verses.name: Sirach 50:9
verses.text: As fire and incense in the censer, and as a vessel of beaten gold set with all manner of precious stones:

verses.name: Sirach 50:10
verses.text: And as a fair olive tree budding forth fruit, and as a cypress tree which groweth up to the clouds.

verses.name: Sirach 50:11
verses.text: When he put on the robe of honour, and was clothed with the perfection of glory, when he went up to the holy altar, he made the garment of holiness honourable.

verses.name: Sirach 50:12
verses.text: When he took the portions out of the priestsâ€™ hands, he himself stood by the hearth of the altar, compassed about, as a young cedar in Libanus; and as palm trees compassed they him round about.

verses.name: Sirach 50:13
verses.text: So were all the sons of Aaron in their glory, and the oblations of the Lord in their hands, before all the congregation of Israel.

verses.name: Sirach 50:14
verses.text: And finishing the service at the altar, that he might adorn the offering of the most high Almighty,

verses.name: Sirach 50:15
verses.text: He stretched out his hand to the cup, and poured of the blood of the grape, he poured out at the foot of the altar a sweetsmelling savour unto the most high King of all.

verses.name: Sirach 50:16
verses.text: Then shouted the sons of Aaron, and sounded the silver trumpets, and made a great noise to be heard, for a remembrance before the most High.

verses.name: Sirach 50:17
verses.text: Then all the people together hasted, and fell down to the earth upon their faces to worship their Lord God Almighty, the most High.

verses.name: Sirach 50:18
verses.text: The singers also sang praises with their voices, with great variety of sounds was there made sweet melody.

verses.name: Sirach 50:19
verses.text: And the people besought the Lord, the most High, by prayer before him that is merciful, till the solemnity of the Lord was ended, and they had finished his service.

verses.name: Sirach 50:20
verses.text: Then he went down, and lifted up his hands over the whole congregation of the children of Israel, to give the blessing of the Lord with his lips, and to rejoice in his name.

verses.name: Sirach 50:21
verses.text: And they bowed themselves down to worship the second time, that they might receive a blessing from the most High.

verses.name: Sirach 50:22
verses.text: Now therefore bless ye the God of all, which only doeth wondrous things every where, which exalteth our days from the womb, and dealeth with us according to his mercy.

verses.name: Sirach 50:23
verses.text: He grant us joyfulness of heart, and that peace may be in our days in Israel for ever:

verses.name: Sirach 50:24
verses.text: That he would confirm his mercy with us, and deliver us at his time!

verses.name: Sirach 50:25
verses.text: There be two manner of nations which my heart abhorreth, and the third is no nation:

verses.name: Sirach 50:26
verses.text: They that sit upon the mountain of Samaria, and they that dwell among the Philistines, and that foolish people that dwell in Sichem.

verses.name: Sirach 50:27
verses.text: Jesus the son of Sirach of Jerusalem hath written in this book the instruction of understanding and knowledge, who out of his heart poured forth wisdom.

verses.name: Sirach 50:28
verses.text: Blessed is he that shall be exercised in these things; and he that layeth them up in his heart shall become wise.

verses.name: Sirach 50:29
verses.text: For if he do them, he shall be strong to all things: for the light of the Lord leadeth him, who giveth wisdom to the godly. Blessed be the name of the Lord for ever. Amen, Amen.

verses.name: Sirach 51:1
verses.text: I will thank thee, O Lord and King, and praise thee, O God my Saviour: I do give praise unto thy name:

verses.name: Sirach 51:2
verses.text: For thou art my defender and helper, and has preserved my body from destruction, and from the snare of the slanderous tongue, and from the lips that forge lies, and has been mine helper against mine adversaries:

verses.name: Sirach 51:3
verses.text: And hast delivered me, according to the multitude of they mercies and greatness of thy name, from the teeth of them that were ready to devour me, and out of the hands of such as sought after my life, and from the manifold afflictions which I had;

verses.name: Sirach 51:4
verses.text: From the choking of fire on every side, and from the midst of the fire which I kindled not;

verses.name: Sirach 51:5
verses.text: From the depth of the belly of hell, from an unclean tongue, and from lying words.

verses.name: Sirach 51:6
verses.text: By an accusation to the king from an unrighteous tongue my soul drew near even unto death, my life was near to the hell beneath.

verses.name: Sirach 51:7
verses.text: They compassed me on every side, and there was no man to help me: I looked for the succour of men, but there was none.

verses.name: Sirach 51:8
verses.text: Then thought I upon thy mercy, O Lord, and upon thy acts of old, how thou deliverest such as wait for thee, and savest them out of the hands of the enemies.

verses.name: Sirach 51:9
verses.text: Then lifted I up my supplications from the earth, and prayed for deliverance from death.

verses.name: Sirach 51:10
verses.text: I called upon the Lord, the Father of my Lord, that he would not leave me in the days of my trouble, and in the time of the proud, when there was no help.

verses.name: Sirach 51:11
verses.text: I will praise thy name continually, and will sing praises with thanksgiving; and so my prayer was heard:

verses.name: Sirach 51:12
verses.text: For thou savedst me from destruction, and deliveredst me from the evil time: therefore will I give thanks, and praise thee, and bless they name, O Lord.

verses.name: Sirach 51:13
verses.text: When I was yet young, or ever I went abroad, I desired wisdom openly in my prayer.

verses.name: Sirach 51:14
verses.text: I prayed for her before the temple, and will seek her out even to the end.

verses.name: Sirach 51:15
verses.text: Even from the flower till the grape was ripe hath my heart delighted in her: my foot went the right way, from my youth up sought I after her.

verses.name: Sirach 51:16
verses.text: I bowed down mine ear a little, and received her, and gat much learning.

verses.name: Sirach 51:17
verses.text: I profited therein, therefore will I ascribe glory unto him that giveth me wisdom.

verses.name: Sirach 51:18
verses.text: For I purposed to do after her, and earnestly I followed that which is good; so shall I not be confounded.

verses.name: Sirach 51:19
verses.text: My soul hath wrestled with her, and in my doings I was exact: I stretched forth my hands to the heaven above, and bewailed my ignorances of her.

verses.name: Sirach 51:20
verses.text: I directed my soul unto her, and I found her in pureness: I have had my heart joined with her from the beginning, therefore shall I not be foresaken.

verses.name: Sirach 51:21
verses.text: My heart was troubled in seeking her: therefore have I gotten a good possession.

verses.name: Sirach 51:22
verses.text: The Lord hath given me a tongue for my reward, and I will praise him therewith.

verses.name: Sirach 51:23
verses.text: Draw near unto me, ye unlearned, and dwell in the house of learning.

verses.name: Sirach 51:24
verses.text: Wherefore are ye slow, and what say ye to these things, seeing your souls are very thirsty?

verses.name: Sirach 51:25
verses.text: I opened my mouth, and said, Buy her for yourselves without money.

verses.name: Sirach 51:26
verses.text: Put your neck under the yoke, and let your soul receive instruction: she is hard at hand to find.

verses.name: Sirach 51:27
verses.text: Behold with your eyes, how that I have but little labour, and have gotten unto me much rest.

verses.name: Sirach 51:28
verses.text: Get learning with a great sum of money, and get much gold by her.

verses.name: Sirach 51:29
verses.text: Let your soul rejoice in his mercy, and be not ashamed of his praise.

verses.name: Sirach 51:30
verses.text: Work your work betimes, and in his time he will give you your reward.
